alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Rusk; San Augustine; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 8:30AM CDT until March 30 at 2:55AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following bayou in Texas... Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno affecting Nacogdoches, Shelby, San Augustine and Rusk Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno, Texas. * WHEN...Until the early hours of Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14 feet, Expect lowland flooding for the next several days of the heavily wooded floodplain. Ranchers that have cattle and equipment near the bayou should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum bayou stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM CDT Tuesday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The bayou is expected to fall below flood stage this Tuesday morning and continue falling to 6.4 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 14 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CDT.
